message.content:
I need to analyze the cash flow statement to identify the net addition (or decrease) in cash and cash equivalents, along with its component parts.

Looking at the statement provided, I can see the "Net Increase" line item shows a value of -21595289.91 on 2024-02-05. This represents the change in cash and cash equivalents during the period.

To decompose this into component sub-items, I need to identify the relevant financial data that makes up this value. From the statement, I can see:

1. The "Beginning Balance" of Cash and Cash Equivalents is 20000000.00
2. The "Ending Balance" of Cash and Cash Equivalents is -1595289.91

These two values are the sub-items that, when subtracted (Ending - Beginning), give us the Net Increase value:
-1595289.91 - 20000000.00 = -21595289.91

Therefore:
- The value of the net addition (actually a decrease) is -21595289.91
- Sub-item value1 is the Beginning Balance: 20000000.00
- Sub-item value2 is the Ending Balance: -1595289.91

```json
{"solution": {'value': '-21595289.91', 'sub_items': {'sub_item value1': '20000000.00', 'sub_item value2': '-1595289.91'}}}
```
